name: 0000-CUSTFILE-OPEN
code:
0000-CUSTFILE-OPEN.
           MOVE 8 TO APPL-RESULT.
           OPEN INPUT CUSTFILE-FILE
           IF  CUSTFILE-STATUS = '00'
               MOVE 0 TO APPL-RESULT
           ELSE
               MOVE 12 TO APPL-RESULT
           END-IF
           IF  APPL-AOK
               CONTINUE
           ELSE
               DISPLAY 'ERROR OPENING CUSTFILE'
               MOVE CUSTFILE-STATUS TO IO-STATUS
               PERFORM Z-DISPLAY-IO-STATUS
               PERFORM Z-ABEND-PROGRAM
           END-IF
           EXIT.
summary: This paragraph is responsible for opening the `CUSTFILE-FILE` for input. It initializes an application result status, attempts the file open, and then checks the operation's success. If the file fails to open, it displays an error message with the file status and then terminates the program. If the file opens successfully, it updates the application result and allows processing to continue.

name: 1000-CUSTFILE-GET-NEXT
code:
1000-CUSTFILE-GET-NEXT.
           READ CUSTFILE-FILE INTO CUSTOMER-RECORD.
           IF  CUSTFILE-STATUS = '00'
               MOVE 0 TO APPL-RESULT
               DISPLAY CUSTOMER-RECORD 
           ELSE
               IF  CUSTFILE-STATUS = '10'
                   MOVE 16 TO APPL-RESULT
               ELSE
                   MOVE 12 TO APPL-RESULT
               END-IF
           END-IF
           IF  APPL-AOK
               CONTINUE
           ELSE
               IF  APPL-EOF
                   MOVE 'Y' TO END-OF-FILE
               ELSE
                   DISPLAY 'ERROR READING CUSTOMER FILE'
                   MOVE CUSTFILE-STATUS TO IO-STATUS
                   PERFORM Z-DISPLAY-IO-STATUS
                   PERFORM Z-ABEND-PROGRAM
               END-IF
           END-IF
           EXIT.
summary:
This paragraph attempts to read the next record from the `CUSTFILE-FILE`. It checks the file status after the read operation:
*   If successful, it sets an application result to zero and displays the customer record.
*   If it reaches the end of the file, it sets an application result indicating end-of-file.
*   For any other read error, it sets a different application result code.

Subsequently, it evaluates these application results:
*   If the operation was successful, it continues.
*   If the end of the file was reached, it sets a specific end-of-file flag.
*   If any other error occurred during the read, it displays an error message, records the file status, and then calls routines to display the I/O status and abnormally terminate the program.

name: 9000-CUSTFILE-CLOSE
code:
9000-CUSTFILE-CLOSE.
           ADD 8 TO ZERO GIVING APPL-RESULT.
           CLOSE CUSTFILE-FILE
           IF  CUSTFILE-STATUS = '00'
               SUBTRACT APPL-RESULT FROM APPL-RESULT
           ELSE
               ADD 12 TO ZERO GIVING APPL-RESULT
           END-IF
           IF  APPL-AOK
               CONTINUE
           ELSE
               DISPLAY 'ERROR CLOSING CUSTOMER FILE'
               MOVE CUSTFILE-STATUS TO IO-STATUS
               PERFORM Z-DISPLAY-IO-STATUS
               PERFORM Z-ABEND-PROGRAM
           END-IF
           EXIT.
summary: This paragraph is responsible for closing the `CUSTFILE-FILE`. It sets an initial application result code, then attempts to close the file. Based on the file close status, it updates the application result code. If an error occurred during the file closing, it displays an error message, shows the I/O status, and then terminates the program.

name: Z-ABEND-PROGRAM
code:
Z-ABEND-PROGRAM.
           DISPLAY 'ABENDING PROGRAM'
           MOVE 0 TO TIMING
           MOVE 999 TO ABCODE
           CALL 'CEE3ABD' USING ABCODE, TIMING.
summary: This paragraph handles program abnormal termination (abend). It displays a message indicating an impending abend, sets specific numeric values for timing and abend codes, and then calls a system routine (`CEE3ABD`) to trigger the abnormal program termination using these codes.

name: Z-DISPLAY-IO-STATUS
code:
Z-DISPLAY-IO-STATUS.
           IF  IO-STATUS NOT NUMERIC
           OR  IO-STAT1 = '9'
               MOVE IO-STAT1 TO IO-STATUS-04(1:1)
               MOVE 0        TO TWO-BYTES-BINARY
               MOVE IO-STAT2 TO TWO-BYTES-RIGHT
               MOVE TWO-BYTES-BINARY TO IO-STATUS-0403
               DISPLAY 'FILE STATUS IS: NNNN' IO-STATUS-04 
           ELSE
               MOVE '0000' TO IO-STATUS-04
               MOVE IO-STATUS TO IO-STATUS-04(3:2)
               DISPLAY 'FILE STATUS IS: NNNN' IO-STATUS-04 
           END-IF
           EXIT.
summary: This COBOL paragraph, `Z-DISPLAY-IO-STATUS`, is responsible for formatting and displaying a file's I/O status. It checks if the `IO-STATUS` is non-numeric or indicates a special condition (`IO-STAT1 = '9'`). If so, it constructs a specific four-character status message using parts of `IO-STATUS` and a binary value, then displays it. Otherwise, for numeric `IO-STATUS` values, it formats and displays a four-character status by embedding the `IO-STATUS` into a default string.

name: __unnamed_paragraph__
code:
PROCEDURE DIVISION.
           DISPLAY 'START OF EXECUTION OF PROGRAM CBCUS01CFAKE'.
           PERFORM 0000-CUSTFILE-OPEN.

           PERFORM UNTIL END-OF-FILE = 'Y'
               IF  END-OF-FILE = 'N'
                   PERFORM 1000-CUSTFILE-GET-NEXT
                   IF  END-OF-FILE = 'N'
                       DISPLAY CUSTOMER-RECORD2 
                   END-IF
               END-IF
           END-PERFORM.

           PERFORM 9000-CUSTFILE-CLOSE.

           DISPLAY 'END OF EXECUTION OF PROGRAM CBCUS01CFAKE'.

           GOBACK.
summary: This COBOL code defines the main execution logic of a program. It starts by displaying a message indicating the program's beginning, then opens a customer file. It proceeds to read customer records one by one in a loop, displaying each record until the end of the file is reached. Finally, it closes the customer file, displays a message indicating the program's completion, and terminates.

name: 0000-CUSTFILE-OPEN
code:
0000-CUSTFILE-OPEN.
           MOVE 8 TO APPL-RESULT.

           ELSE
               MOVE 12 TO APPL-RESULT
           END-IF
           IF  APPL-AOK
               CONTINUE
           ELSE

               MOVE CUSTFILE-STATUS TO IO-STATUS

summary: This paragraph attempts to open a customer data file for input. It initializes an application result code, then updates it to indicate whether the file was opened successfully or not. If the file opening fails, it displays an error message, logs the specific file status, and then terminates the program.

code:
1000-CUSTFILE-GET-NEXT.
           READ CUSTFILE-FILE INTO CUSTOMER-RECORD.
           IF  CUSTFILE-STATUS = '00'
               MOVE 0 TO APPL-RESULT
               DISPLAY CUSTOMER-RECORD 
           ELSE
               IF  CUSTFILE-STATUS = '10'

           END-IF
           IF  APPL-AOK
               CONTINUE
           ELSE
               IF  APPL-EOF
                   MOVE 'Y' TO END-OF-FILE
               ELSE

                   MOVE CUSTFILE-STATUS TO IO-STATUS

           END-IF

summary:
This paragraph reads the next record from the `CUSTFILE-FILE` into the `CUSTOMER-RECORD`. It then evaluates the file status after the read operation:

*   If the read is successful, it sets an application result to zero and displays the customer record.
*   If the end of the file is reached, it sets an application result indicating end-of-file and a corresponding flag.
*   If any other I/O error occurs during the read, it displays an error message, logs the specific I/O status, and terminates the program.

name: 9000-CUSTFILE-CLOSE
code:
9000-CUSTFILE-CLOSE.
           ADD 8 TO ZERO GIVING APPL-RESULT.
           CLOSE CUSTFILE-FILE
           IF  CUSTFILE-STATUS = '00'
               SUBTRACT APPL-RESULT FROM APPL-RESULT
           ELSE
               ADD 12 TO ZERO GIVING APPL-RESULT
           END-IF
           IF  APPL-AOK
               CONTINUE
           ELSE
               DISPLAY 'ERROR CLOSING CUSTOMER FILE'
               MOVE CUSTFILE-STATUS TO IO-STATUS
               PERFORM Z-DISPLAY-IO-STATUS
               PERFORM Z-ABEND-PROGRAM
           END-IF
           EXIT.
summary: This paragraph is responsible for closing the `CUSTFILE-FILE`. It initializes an application result code, then attempts to close the file. Based on the file close status, it updates the result code. If the close operation fails or if the application's overall \OK\" status is not set, it displays an error message, shows the specific I/O status, and then abnormally terminates the program."

name: Z-ABEND-PROGRAM
code:
Z-ABEND-PROGRAM.
           DISPLAY 'ABENDING PROGRAM'
           MOVE 0 TO TIMING
           MOVE 999 TO ABCODE
           CALL 'CEE3ABD' USING ABCODE, TIMING.
summary: This paragraph is responsible for performing an abnormal termination of the program. It first displays a message indicating the program is abending, then sets specific numeric codes (0 for `TIMING` and 999 for `ABCODE`), and finally calls an external system routine (`CEE3ABD`) to force the program to stop with these codes.

name: Z-DISPLAY-IO-STATUS
code:
Z-DISPLAY-IO-STATUS.
           IF  IO-STATUS NOT NUMERIC
           OR  IO-STAT1 = '9'
               MOVE IO-STAT1 TO IO-STATUS-04(1:1)
               MOVE 0        TO TWO-BYTES-BINARY
               MOVE IO-STAT2 TO TWO-BYTES-RIGHT
               MOVE TWO-BYTES-BINARY TO IO-STATUS-0403
               DISPLAY 'FILE STATUS IS: NNNN' IO-STATUS-04 
           ELSE
               MOVE '0000' TO IO-STATUS-04
               MOVE IO-STATUS TO IO-STATUS-04(3:2)
               DISPLAY 'FILE STATUS IS: NNNN' IO-STATUS-04 
           END-IF
           EXIT.
summary: This paragraph, `Z-DISPLAY-IO-STATUS`, is responsible for formatting and displaying the file I/O status. It checks if the `IO-STATUS` indicates a special non-numeric or error condition (first digit '9'). If so, it constructs a specific 4-character status string using parts of the `IO-STATUS` and displays it. Otherwise, for standard numeric status, it formats the `IO-STATUS` into a 4-character string starting with '00' and displays it.

name: __unnamed_paragraph__
code:
PROCEDURE DIVISION.
           DISPLAY 'START OF EXECUTION OF PROGRAM CBCUS01C'.
           PERFORM 0000-CUSTFILE-OPEN.

           PERFORM UNTIL END-OF-FILE = 'Y'
               IF  END-OF-FILE = 'N'
                   PERFORM 1000-CUSTFILE-GET-NEXT
                   IF  END-OF-FILE = 'N'
                       DISPLAY CUSTOMER-RECORD2 
                   END-IF
               END-IF
           END-PERFORM.

           PERFORM 9000-CUSTFILE-CLOSE.

           DISPLAY 'END OF EXECUTION OF PROGRAM CBCUS01C'.

           GOBACK.
summary: This COBOL code defines the main processing logic of the program. It starts by displaying a message, then opens a customer file. It then enters a loop to read and display customer records one by one until the end of the file is reached. After processing all records, it closes the customer file, displays a program completion message, and then exits.
